name: Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore
description: Sandstone cliffs, beaches, waterfalls, sand dunes, inland lakes, deep forest, and wild shoreline beckon you to visit Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore. The power of Lake Superior shapes the park's coastal features and affects every ecosystem, creating a unique landscape to explore. Hiking, camping, sightseeing, and four-season outdoor opportunities abound.
shortDescription: Sandstone cliffs, beaches, waterfalls, sand dunes, inland lakes, deep forest, and wild shoreline beckon you to visit Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore. The power of Lake Superior shapes the park's coa...

operatingHours.description: Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore is open year-round, 24 hours a day, though most roads are closed by snow in the winter. Sand Point Road is the only park road plowed in winter.

fees.title: Entrance - Private Vehicle
fees.description: This pass admits the driver and all passengers in a private-use vehicle for seven consecutive days to all areas of Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore. This fee does not cover additional fees associated with activities such as camping or commercial tours.

fees.title: Entrance - Motorcycle
fees.description: Valid for 7 days. Admits up to 2 private, non-commercial motorcycles with up to 4 total passengers to all areas of Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore. This fee does not cover additional fees associated with activities such as camping or commercial tours.

fees.title: Entrance - Snowmobile
fees.description: This pass admits a snowmobile to all parts of Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore for 7 consecutive days. This fee does not cover additional fees associated with activities such as camping or commercial tours.

fees.title: Entrance - Per Person
fees.description: This pass admits one walk-in, bicycle-in, or boat-in person to all parts of Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore. This fee does not cover additional fees associated with activities such as camping or commercial tours.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Sedan
fees.description: This admits a commercial sedan to all areas of Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore. The flat rate for this pass is $25, plus an additional $5 per person age 16+. This fee does not cover additional fees associated with activities such as camping or commercial tours.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Van
fees.description: This pass admits a commercial van with a capacity of 7-16 persons, regardless of capacity, to all parts of Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore. This fee does not cover additional fees associated with activities such as camping or commercial tours.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Mini-bus
fees.description: This fee admits a commercial mini-bus to all parts of Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore. A mini-bus is defined as a vehicle with a 16-25 person capacity. The fee is charged regardless of occupancy of the vehicle. This fee does not cover additional fees associated with activities such as camping or commercial tours.

fees.title: Commercial Entrance - Motor Coach
fees.description: This fee applies to commercial vehicles with a 26+ person vehicle capacity, regardless of occupancy. This fee does not cover additional fees associated with activities such as camping or commercial tours.

climate.weatherDescription: Summers are pleasant with the average highs in June, July, and August in the 70s째F, and lows in the low 50s째F. The coldest months are December through March with average highs of 25째F to 32째F, and average lows in the teens. Annual precipitation averages 31 inches; average annual snowfall is about 140 inches, although winters with more than 200 inches are not uncommon. Snow generally covers the ground from late November through late April.

images.title: Battleship Row
images.altText: Three sections of cliffs sticking out into Lake Superior like the bows of battleships.
images.caption: 15 miles of carved and colorful cliffs along the Lake Superior shoreine.

images.title: Grand Sable Dunes
images.altText: The Grand Sable Dunes rise up 300 feet from Lake Superior.
images.caption: The Grand Sable Dunes rise up 300 feet from Lake Superior.

images.title: Kayaking Along the Pictured Rocks Cliffs
images.altText: Kayakers near Lovers Leap rock arch formation
images.caption: Kayakers near Lovers Leap

images.title: Backcountry Camping - Benchmark Site
images.altText: Backcountry camping at Benchmark site showing tent surrounded by ferns and trees.
images.caption: Backpacking and camping are a popular activities.

images.title: Ice Climbing
images.altText: Ice climber on a curtain of ice along the Pictured Rocks Escarpment
images.caption: Ice climbing is a popular winter activity.

images.title: Miners Falls
images.altText: High volume of water flowing at Miners Falls
images.caption: Water flowing over Miners Falls

images.title: Miner's Castle
images.altText: Miner's Castle rock formation along the Lake Superior shoreline.
images.caption: View the Miner's Castle rock formation from the adjacent cliffs or from a boat.

images.title: Pictured Rocks Cliffs along the Chapel / Mosquito Loop
images.altText: Mineral stained cliffs and collapsed rock arch along Lake Superior
images.caption: Springtime along the Chapel / Mosquito hiking loop
